item.title: Sea of Thieves: All Commendations in The Legend of Monkey Island
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Are Commendations In Sea Of Thieves?
  • All Commendations In The Legend Of Monkey Island

Sea of Thieves is an online game developed by Rare and published by Xbox Game Studios. The game follows the player character, who is a pirate, as they travel around an open world map and complete various voyages. The game allows players to work with one another and explore the world together on their voyages.

While the game had a rocky start, it is now one of the most popular co-op video games out there, and players absolutely love it. One of the expansions released for the game is entitled The Legend of Monkey Island, which is based on the famous series Monkey Island. Here's a list of all the commendations in this expansion of the game.

What Are Commendations In Sea Of Thieves?

Commendations are Sea of Thieves' equivalent of achievements or trophies. When a player does something that fulfills the specific requirements of a commendation, they will be rewarded one, just like an achievement would work. Sometimes, these may unlock titles or cosmetics that players can make use of. Other times, they may obtain Doubloons from completing them. This means that they are definitely something that players will want to make sure they are completing and keeping track of. That way, they can make the most of them.

All Commendations In The Legend Of Monkey Island

There are a total of 16 Commendations that players can obtain in this expansion. Here's a list of them all and how to obtain them.

Commendation

How To Obtain It

Hired Help

Players need to purchase the Chef's Uniform.

Delayed in Transit

The Citizen of Melee's Missing Cargo must be delivered.

Prison Break

Free Otis.

Save the Clock Tower

The clock needs to be repaired and set to midnight.

House Call

Find a way into the Govenor's Mansion.

The Journey to Melee Island

Complete the Journey to Melee Island.

Pop-Up Pirates

10 Ghost Pirates must be defeated with Root Beer.

In Good Company

Sit down in a seat within the Scumm Bar.

Elected Legend

Read all about the re-election campaign of Guybrush.

Groggy Dog Story

Listen to everything that Spiffy says.

A Guided Tour

Take a tour of the town's key areas with Murray.

Melee Island Historian

Buy the Melee Island History Book.

Memoirs of a Legend, Vol. 1

View all the Memoir Spots.

Melee Island Investigator

Complete all the Commendations for the Tall Tale of The Journey to Melee Island.

Legend of Monkey Island Figurines

Complete the Journey to Melee Island Commendation.

Melee by Moonlight

Complete all the commendations in the expansion.

item.title: Hilarious Elden Ring Clip Proves Player Messages Are as Humorous as Ever
item.description:
Highlights

  • Messages in Elden Ring can be helpful or deceptive, but they can also add creative moments of humor to players' experiences.
  • For example, a hilarious message in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC sees a player warned that they will be hit with an explosion after reading the message.
  • In a video, the perfect timing of this player not is put on full display, as immediately after the message is read the explosion occurs.

Player messages in Elden Ring sometimes turn out to be a bittersweet experience for those who come acros, and one user has highlighted a really hilarious one they found in one of the catacombs in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC. Messages have been a staple of the Soulsborne franchise for a long time, with players using the Elden Ring feature to help others or even deceive fellow Tarnished at times.

Many times, players use messages to give tips to others for fighting bosses or revealing hidden paths. One popular example of this is in one of the Crystal Tunnels in Elden Ring , where one would find themselves dealing barely any damage to the area boss. However, numerous messages outside the boss arena suggest that players should try jump attacks, which end up quickly breaking the enemy's poise, making the fight a cakewalk. However, certain messages - like the ones around the fake invisible walls in Elden Ring's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC - lure players to death.

In a new post on the Elden Ring, user ryuki987 showcases an extremely hilarious moment they experienced in one of the dungeons of the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC. In the video, the player makes their way through a stairway that has a couple of messages. The first one is merely a warning which asks them to "be wary of fire." However, it is the second one which is quite humorous, as the message is placed towards the end of the stairs and reads "First off, message, and then explosion!"

Elden Ring's Creative Messages Continues To Impress The Community

While it might sound like an innocuous message at first, it's the placement of the Elden Ring message that makes it so funny. Barely a few seconds after the player opens the message, they are hit by a fireball from the dungeon. The comedic essence of the moment is that the incident occurs slightly late after the message is opened, which pretty much coincides with the exact time a player would start reading the second sentence of the message which talks about the explosion.

Just like the original poster, other players were quick to appreciate the comedic timing of the message, with some even calling it their favorite message in the game. This is not the only instance of players using messages in a creative way. In fact, players used something similar for one of the invisible bridges in Elden Ring 's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC. By placing messages at the edge of the bridge, they not only helped other players identify that it was a hidden path, but also marked the boundary to show others how to properly explore.

item.title: Soulmask: All Proficiencies & What They Do
item.description:
In Soulmask , players will need to adapt to survive in the wilderness around them by recruiting Tribe members, foraging materials from their environment, building shelter, and developing their base. As you and your Tribe members participate in various activities such as combat, foraging, and tending to the upkeep of your base campsite, you will be able to develop their proficiency in a certain skill.

For this reason, knowing which activities you will need to do to increase a certain proficiency will come in handy, as well as an explaination of what each proficiency is related to. Everything that players will need to know regarding these matters has been outlined in the guide below.

All Proficiencies & What They Do in Soulmask

Proficiency

Type

How to Increase

What it Does

Logging

Production Crafting

Chop down trees

  • Increase Logging speed
  • Increase Logging output
  • Decrease Logging tool durability cost
  • Decrease Logging stamina cost

Mining

Production Crafting

Mine ores

  • Increase Mining speed
  • Increase Mining output
  • Decrease Mining tool durability cost
  • Decrease Mining stamina cost

Harvesting

Production Crafting

Collect wild plants

  • Increase Harvesting speed
  • Increase Harvesting output
  • Decrease Harvesting tool durability cost
  • Decrease Harvesting stamina cost

Plant

Production Crafting

Plant, harvest, and/or grow crops

  • Increase crop growth speed
  • Increase collecting output
  • Decrease crop fertilizer cost
  • Decrease crop water consumption

Weaving

Production Crafting

Weave textiles and ropes

  • Increase Weaving speed
  • Increase Weaving output
  • Reduced material cost when weaving

Potting

Production Crafting

Make pottery

  • Increase pottery craft speed
  • Decrease pottery material cost

Wood & Stone

Production Crafting

Cut stone, process wooden items, or craft structures with stone or wood.

  • Reduced material cost
  • Increased crafting speed
  • Increased output

Leatherworking

Production Crafting

Dissect animal carcasses, tan leather, process tanning materials

  • Increase tanning speed
  • Decrease tanning material cost

Kiln

Production Crafting

Melt metals in a furnace

  • Increase smelting speed
  • Increase smelting output
  • Increase pottery firing speed
  • Increase pottery output

Craftsman

Production Crafting

Craft and uncraft tools

  • Increase tool crafting speed
  • Increase tool output
  • Decrease tool crafting material cost

Alchemy

Production Crafting

Craft medicine and mixtures

  • Increase alchemy production speed
  • Decrease alchemy material cost

Cooking

Production Crafting

Process food

  • Increase Cooking speed
  • Increase Cooking output
  • Decrease cooking material cost

Weapon Crafting

Production Crafting

Craft weapons

  • Increase weapon crafting speed
  • Decrease weapon material costs
  • Increased weapon durability limit

Armor Crafting

Production Crafting

Craft armor

  • Increase armor crafting speed
  • Increase armor durability limit
  • Increase gear quality

Spear

Combat Skill

Deal damage with a spear

  • Increase spear damage
  • Increase spear attack speed
  • Decrease spear stamina cost

Shield

Combat Skill

Defend with a shield

  • Increase damage when defending with a shield
  • Decrease stamina reduction when defending with a shield

Blade

Combat Skill

Deal damage with a blade

  • Increase blade damage
  • Increase blade attack speed
  • Decrease blade stamina cost

Bow

Combat Skill

Deal damage with a bow

  • Increase bow damage
  • Increase bow attack speed
  • Decrease bow stamina cost

Dual-Blade

Combat Skill

Deal damage with a dual-blade

  • Increase dual-blade damage
  • Increase dual-blade attack speed
  • Decrease dual-blade stamina cost

Gauntlet

Combat Skill

Deal damage with gauntlets

  • Increase gauntlets damage
  • Increase gauntlets attack speed
  • Decrease gauntlets stamina cost

Hammer

Combat Skill

Deal damage with a hammer

  • Increase hammer damage
  • Increase hammer attack speed
  • Decrease hammer stamina cost

Great Sword

Combat Skill

Deal damage with a great sword

  • Increase great sword damage
  • Increase great sword attack speed
  • Decrease great sword stamina cost

item.title: Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Reveal Seven Star Tera Raid For Final Hoenn Starter
item.description:
Highlights

  • Players should get ready to face Sceptile in Seven-Star Tera Raids from late June to early July in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet.
  • Sceptile, a speed-focused Grass-type Pokemon with access to powerful moves, will challenge seasoned trainers and their teams.
  • The Tera-Dragon type Sceptile will have its weaknesses, so Fairy-type Pokemon such as Sylveon and Alolan Ninetales will be effective.

With summer underway, Pokemon Scarlet and Violet confirmed that players will face Sceptile the Unrivaled in Seven-Star Tera Raids running from late June to early July. The upcoming Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Seven-Star Tera Raid boss is the final starter Pokemon from the Hoenn region to be featured as a challenge for seasoned trainers and their teams.

Known as the Forest Pokemon, Sceptile first appeared in Pokemon Ruby and Sapphire . Sceptile is the fully evolved form of Treecko and Grovyle and is usually a pure Grass-type Pokemon. Unlike its counterparts, Blaziken and Swampert, Sceptile is a speed-focused special attacker, with access to moves including Energy Ball, Dragon Pulse, and Focus Blast that can take advantage of it. Sceptile can also use bolstering moves like Dragon Dance, Agility, and Double Team to give itself breathing room against strong foes. However, the lowest stats it has are in Defense and HP. Sceptile can be obtained in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet: The Indigo Disk by fully evolving a Treecko caught in the Terarium's Canyon Biome.

As Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players dispatch Emboar the Unrivaled, a new challenge will soon appear for them to face. According to Serebii.net, the Seven-Star Tera Raid battle against Sceptile the Unrivaled will begin Thursday, June 27, at 8:00 PM Eastern, and end Sunday, June 30, at 7:59 PM Eastern. Pokemon trainers who miss the first round will get a second chance the following weekend, from July 4 to 7, at the same starting and ending times. Sceptile the Unrivaled will have the Dragon type as its Tera type, and it will grant the Mightiest Mark to all Pokemon that defeat it.

Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Seven-Star Tera Raid Details (Sceptile the Rivaled)

  • Starts Thursday, June 27, at 8:00 PM Eastern, and Ends Sunday, June 30, at 7:59 PM Eastern.
  • The second round will run from July 4 through 7, at the same start and end times.
  • Sceptile the Unrivaled will have the Tera-Dragon type and the Hidden Ability called Unburden.

Sceptile the Unrivaled's Tera type is a callback to its Mega Evolution form, which first appeared in Pokemon Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire . Sceptile's Dragon-type moves, including Dragon Tail and Breaking Swipe, will be amplified. However, the Forest Pokemon has a few flaws for trainers to exploit. Its Hidden Ability, called Unburden, will not be a factor, as Tera Raid boss Pokemon usually do not hold items. While Dragon Pokemon are formidable, Fairy-type Pokemon will render some of Sceptile's moves useless. With low physical defenses, Fairy attacks like Play Rough will also hit the Forest Pokemon hard.

Fairy Pokemon like Sylveon, Alolan Ninetails, and Galarian Weezing will be quite effective for dealing with Sceptile the Unrivaled. What strategies Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players will form to beat Sceptile the Unrivaled remains to be seen.

item.title: Elden Ring Director Wants to Make a Traditional JRPG
item.description:
Highlights

  • FromSoftware studio head Hidetaka Miyazaki wants to explore making a traditional JRPG, breaking away from his Soulslike fame.
  • FromSoftware has a diverse history, including a JRPG like Enchanted Arms, but Miyazaki wants to create something new.
  • However, players shouldn't expect to see sequels to old FromSoft games under Miyazaki, who aims to focus on new creations and genres.

Elden Ring creative director and FromSoftware studio head Hidetaka Miyazaki has revealed that he'd like to take a shot at developing a traditional JRPG someday. The acclaimed game designer has largely been recognized for his work on Soulslikes in recent years, so seeing him express interest in making a title in a genre atypical of his past efforts is a bit surprising. Regardless, the prospect of a JRPG helmed by the creators of Elden Ring would likely set certain corners of the FromSoftware fanbase ablaze with excitement.

Although FromSoftware is nowadays best known for being the studio behind massively successful titles like Dark Souls , Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice , and Elden Ring , the company has a rather eclectic library of games in its lengthy development portfolio. FromSoft initially made its debut with the bizarre King's Field series of action RPGs. Afterward, the company branched out and worked on a wide variety of other games, like the 3D platformer The Adventures of Cookie & Cream and the cult-classic hack-and-slash Otogi . Ever since Hidetaka Miyazaki became president of the studio in 2014, though, FromSoftware has largely pigeonholed itself into a few genres. This hasn't necessarily been a bad thing for the company, but Miyazaki is nonetheless looking to shake things up.

During an interview with Rolling Stone, Miyazaki stated that he's interested in experimenting with new genres outside the Soulslike formula that FromSoftware established with its brutally difficult games. Specifically, he mentioned that part of him wants to create a traditional JRPG. While Miyazaki has yet to make such a game, FromSoftware itself has actually developed a JRPG before. After all, in 2006, the company released a Japanese role-playing game, published — oddly enough — by Ubisoft, for the Xbox 360 named Enchanted Arms . Though this particular title wasn't received all that well, if Miyazaki were to make a game in a similar vein, it could end up being something special.

If Miyazaki Does Make a JRPG, It Likely Won't Be a Sequel To Enchanted Arms

Despite Miyazaki's interest in developing a JRPG, don't expect FromSoftware to release Enchanted Arms 2 anytime soon. In fact, don't expect the company to return to the worlds of most old FromSoft games at all under Miyazaki's leadership, as the studio head isn't interested in creating new entries in franchises that he wasn't involved in the creation of. Explaining this stance of his, Miyazaki said that he thinks "a lot of these games are so intertwined with the directors who almost invented that style of game." As such, he doesn't see a scenario where he himself "would make a King’s Field . The same can be said about Otogi and Enchanted Arms ."

FromSoftware's current approach of sticking to only a few genres has paid dividends for the company, as evidenced by the recent release of Elden Ring 's new DLC, the critically-acclaimed Shadow of the Erdtree expansion. Even still, it would be interesting to see FromSoftware and Miyazaki branch out by making a traditional JRPG in the vein of a Final Fantasy or Tales game.
